homepage.question: Hi, I'm shana! What brings you here today?

academia.title: Academia
academia.introduction1: Hey! Welcome to the place where a bunch of things I’ve done are listed. I’m a member of the LUXIA lab at USI, where I’m currently a Research Assistant working on AI to reflect on implicit bias with children and families (check out the
academia.introduction2: ). In November, I’ll start my PhD on using social robots with children with different abilities, focusing on intellectual disabilities, to explore the Learning by Teaching paradigm to enhance soft skills and self‑awareness. During my master’s thesis, I conducted an exploratory study on technology use by adults with intellectual disabilities, that’s where my interest in HCI and accessibility deepened its roots. I’m in academia because I want to learn, discover, and make a real difference. I don’t do research to check boxes, I do it driven by curiosity and the urge to understand how things currently work and how they can empower people. Not for the sake of doing it, but for the deeper meaning behind it.
